intro: Lens culinaris subsp. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental lentil, is an annual leguminous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It produces small, lens-shaped seeds that are rich in protein and dietary fiber. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and small white or pink flowers. Its seeds are widely cultivated for human consumption and animal feed. The oriental lentil is well adapted to temperate climates and thrives in well-drained soils.
